newsitem.title: UK: Reckitt up on short squeeze, takeover rumor.
newsitem.headline: Reckitt up on short squeeze, takeover rumor.

text.p: Shares in British household products group Reckitt and Colman Plc scored record highs on Wednesday on another round of rumours, which have circulated for the last few months, of a take-over bid by Unilever Plc , traders said.
But traders were sceptical of the rumour and said the gains were more likely from a short squeeze.
A Reckitt spokesman had no comment on the speculation and described its share activity as normal trading.
"Very little has been traded and it appears people want the stock and there is very little around," he said.
Shares were up 24-1/2p at 937p at 1337 GMT after hitting a high of 940p. Shares in other household goods companies were mixed.
"There are rumours that Unilever is going to do something big and whether that is rolling over to Reckitt, it probably is," said one market maker.
Unilever was not immediately available for comment.
Its shares were off 1/2p at 17.56p after also hitting a record high of 17.80p.
Unilever on Monday said it sold its John West Foods business for an undisclosed sum and was not significant in relation to its assets.
A trader said that was not significant enough to spark fresh rumours of a Unilever bid for Reckitt.
"We would say the stock is up 20 pence and someone is trying to think of a reason for it," another market maker said. "There is no stock around."
